definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: One corrupt apple corrupts many sound ones.
sentences.chinese: 一個爛蘋果可以使許多好蘋果爛掉。

sentences.english: The movie's exposition and plotting are mega-lame.
sentences.chinese: 那部電影的情節和故事闡述真是超級爛。

sentences.english: One bad apple spoiled the barrel.
sentences.chinese: 一個爛蘋果，糟蹋一整籮。

sentences.english: And he told his wife the whole story about how he came back with the rotten apples.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴他的妻子換回來爛蘋果的事。

sentences.english: This kind of rotten performing skill clamps in the family war is really only then the share which submerges .
sentences.chinese: 這種爛演技夾在家族大戰裏實在是隻有被淹沒的份。

sentences.english: You're going to buy a bad bed.
sentences.chinese: 你將買到一張爛牀，這事兒你躲不了的。

sentences.english: Okay, so I'm endangering myself so that this evil principle can die?
sentences.chinese: 我自身難保了，這條爛規定可以廢止嗎？

sentences.english: Hey Sarge, why we always got to listen to this shit for anyway?
sentences.chinese: 嘿，中士，我們爲什麼要一直聽這個爛東西？

sentences.english: Good Actors, Bad Movies, and the Oscars
sentences.chinese: 好演員，爛電影，奧斯卡怎麼了？

sentences.english: If they catch a rotten potato, you lose the stockpot.
sentences.chinese: 如果抓到一個爛土豆，你就失去了湯鍋。

sentences.english: Why are all the subconscious mercenaries such bad shots?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼所有潛意識裏的防禦者都槍法都這麼爛？

sentences.english: You can give him to eat the rotten rice, dried meat floss can put points.
sentences.chinese: 你可以給他喫爛米粥了，可以放點肉鬆。

sentences.english: Tell your parents not to ruin the world you will live in.
sentences.chinese: 告訴你的父母別搞爛你未來要生活的世界。

sentences.english: The expression is "One rotten apple spoils the barrel."
sentences.chinese: 這句俗語是“一隻爛蘋果，糟蹋一整籮”。

sentences.english: In order to get an outstanding youth, we have to pay much cost.
sentences.chinese: 對於青春，要獲取璨爛，必須要付出代價。

definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
